Topic: Draw two habitats and the different living things in each
Evidence Statements: The student can identify and draw two different types of habitats, one on land and one in water (e.g., a garden and a pond).
The student can draw a variety of living things, such as plants and animals, found in each habitat.
The student can show specific plants and animals in the land habitat, like trees, grasses, lizards, or squirrels.
The student can illustrate specific plants and animals in the water habitat, like fish, clams, or aquatic plants.
The student can highlight differences in plant and animal life between the land and water habitats.
The student can observe and include patterns of biodiversity in their drawings to show the diversity of life in each habitat.
